articles.title: Why Citigroup Shares Are Moving
articles.author: Henry Khederian
articles.excerpt: Citigroup Inc (NYSE: C) shares are trading lower by 1.9% to $44.98 Tuesday afternoon.
articles.summary:
Citigroup Inc C shares are trading lower by 1.9% to $44.98 Tuesday afternoon. Shares of banking and financial services stocks at large are trading lower after Moody's cut the credit ratings of 10 banks and placed others under review for potential downgrades.

If regional banks' credit rating downgrades are due to broader economic or industry-specific challenges, it could lead investors to question whether Citigroup might also face similar challenges. This perception of systemic risk within the financial sector could lead to a decrease in investor confidence in Citigroup's stability.

articles.title: Citigroup Unusual Options Activity For August 07
articles.author: Benzinga Insights
articles.summary:
A whale with a lot of money to spend has taken a noticeably bullish stance on 
Citigroup
.
Looking at options history for Citigroup 
C
 we detected 27 strange trades.
If we consider the specifics of each trade, it is accurate to state that 62% of the investors opened trades with bullish expectations and 37% with bearish.
From the overall spotted trades, 13 are puts, for a total amount of $1,339,663 and 14, calls, for a total amount of $1,241,809.
What's The Price Target?
Taking into account the Volume and Open Interest on these contracts, it appears that whales have been targeting a price range from $30.

articles.title: Citigroup's Paco Ybarra to Depart After 36 Years at Wall Street Giant
articles.author: Jenny Surane
articles.excerpt: Citigroup Inc.'s Paco Ybarra, one of Chief Executive Officer Jane Fraser's top deputies, will depart after 36 years at the Wall Street giant.
articles.summary:
(Bloomberg) -- Citigroup Inc.'s Paco Ybarra, one of Chief Executive Officer Jane Fraser's top deputies, will depart after 36 years at the Wall Street giant. 
Ybarra, 61, who is head of the firm's institutional clients group, will leave in the first half of next year, according to a memo to staff from Fraser. The institutional business includes Citigroup's trading and investment-banking arms, as well as the firm's treasury and trade division. 
'I deeply value his counsel and partnership, especially during my early days as CEO,' Fraser said in the memo.

articles.title: Citigroup Cuts Office Space 67% In Move To Schaumburg
articles.author: Steven Dilakian
articles.excerpt: Citigroup has signed a lease for 49,400 square feet across two floors in Glenstar's Schaumburg Corporate Center at 1515 East Woodfield Road.
articles.summary:
Citigroup is cutting its office footprint by two thirds in a move to Schaumburg, compounding suburban Chicago's soaring vacancies and prolonging a trend of downsizing amid historically low demand for office space.


The New York-based banking company has signed a lease for 49,400 square feet across two floors in the Schaumburg Corporate Center at 1515 East Woodfield Road, Crain's 
reported
. Citigroup will relocate to the northwest suburb when its 146,000-square-foot lease at 50 NW Point Boulevard in Elk Grove Village expires at the end of the year.

articles.title: Citigroup's Head of Institutional Clients Group to Retire
articles.author: David Benoit
articles.excerpt: Paco Ybarra, the head of Citigroup's operations catering to giant companies and Wall Street, will retire next year, according to a memo sent Thursday. Ybarra has led the institutional clients group, which includes its investment bank, trading and corporate banking operations, since 2019. It houses what is considered the core of the bank: Corporate services that help multinational companies move money around the globe.

articles.title: Citigroup Offers Compelling Value
articles.author: Praveen Chawla
articles.excerpt: New CEO is pushing to unlock value by increasing profitability
articles.summary:
Citigroup Inc. (NYSE:C), a New York-based global financial services company, offers a wide array of services encompassing consumer banking, credit services, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, trade and securities services and wealth management.
Recognized as a significant money center bank, the company's stock has faced downward pressure in light of economic deceleration and underlying inflation-related cost pressures. The company remains strongly capitalized, boasting a Common Equity Tier 1 (CET1) capital ratio of 15%.

articles.title: Glenstar Properties Inks Leases with 12 Tenants for Schaumburg Corporate Center in Suburban Chicago
articles.author: Kristin Harlow
articles.excerpt: SCHAUMBURG, ILL. — Glenstar Properties has executed 12 office leases totaling 154,000 square feet at its Schaumburg Corporate Center in the Chicago suburb of Schaumburg. The lease signings include…
articles.summary:
19
SCHAUMBURG, ILL. — Glenstar Properties has executed 12 office leases totaling 154,000 square feet at its Schaumburg Corporate Center in the Chicago suburb of Schaumburg. The lease signings include 89,000 square feet of new leases and 65,000 square feet of renewals. Schaumburg Corporate Center is a three-building office complex totaling 1 million square feet.
Among the leases was global banking firm Citigroup's new lease for 49,400 square feet across two floors. Citigroup will relocate from its current Northwest suburban office location in January.

articles.title: Citigroup slashing suburban office space, relocating to Schaumburg
articles.author: Danny Ecker
articles.excerpt: The bank is getting rid of two-thirds of its workspace in the northwest suburbs.
articles.summary:
html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD HTML 4.0 Transitional//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-html40/loose.dtd"


Citigroup is getting rid of two-thirds of its suburban Chicago office space and relocating it to Schaumburg, a win for one local landlord and another case of remote work's unrelenting assault on demand for workspace.
The New York-based banking giant has signed a lease for 49,400 square feet on two floors at Schaumburg Corporate Center in the northwest suburb, the company confirmed. Citigroup is expected to move its suburban office to the property at 1515 E.

articles.title: Citigroup CEO of institutional clients group Paco Ybarra to leave
articles.author: Lananh Nguyen
articles.excerpt: Paco Ybarra, the CEO of Citigroup's institutional clients group, will leave in the first half of next year, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters. Ybarra joined Citi in Madrid in 1987 as a…
articles.summary:
By Lananh Nguyen
NEW YORK (Reuters) - Paco Ybarra, the CEO of Citigroup's institutional clients group, will leave in the first half of next year, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.
The 36-year Citi veteran leads the Wall Street firm's banking, markets and services businesses. He helped to establish it as a "powerhouse in fixed income," CEO Jane Fraser wrote in a memo to staff.
Ybarra joined Citi in Madrid in 1987 as a management associate and subsequently worked in Mexico, Singapore, London and New York.

articles.title: Citigroup: Bull Thesis Delayed But Not Aborted (NYSE:C)
articles.author: Ip Banking Research
articles.excerpt: Citigroup still has multiple levers to achieve its medium-term target of 11% to 12% ROE. See why C stock's bull thesis is still expected to play out.
articles.summary:
MNStudio/iStock Editorial via Getty Images
 
In my 
prior article
 on Citigroup (
NYSE:
C
), I set out my thesis where I anticipated the stock would be up by 100% by the end of 2024. This article is an update to my
 bull thesis on Citigroup. I still believe that the thesis will still play out broadly as expected, however, now I expect the timelines to be by the end of 2025 as opposed to 2024, given recent setbacks.
 
In my prior article, I also set out the key risks to my thesis being (1) higher than expected capital requirements and (2) delay in the sale of Banamex Mexico.

articles.title: Goldman Sachs ropes in Citi veteran to oversee card partnerships
articles.author: Thomson Reuters
articles.excerpt: Bill Johnson joins Goldman Sachs as CEO of Enterprise Partnerships in Platform Solutions
articles.summary:
Last Updated: 
8th August, 2023 21:40 IST
 
 
Prior to the current role, Johnson served as CEO of Citi Retail Services
 




 
 
Goldman Sachs, on Tuesday, hired Bill Johnson, a veteran banker from Citigroup to oversee the unit that manages the firm's credit card partnerships with the likes of Apple Inc and General Motors, according to an internal memo accessed by Reuters. 
 
Bill Johnson joins Goldman Sachs as CEO of Enterprise Partnerships in Platform Solutions, its consumer, transaction banking and financial technology unit.

articles.title: MOVES-Citigroup CEO of institutional clients group Paco Ybarra to leave
articles.author: Lananh Nguyen
articles.excerpt: Paco Ybarra, the CEO of Citigroup's institutional clients group, will leave in the first half of next year, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters. Ybarra joined Citi in Madrid in 1987 as a…
articles.summary:
(Updates with detail, career background from paragraph 2)
By Lananh Nguyen
NEW YORK, Aug 3 (Reuters) -
Paco Ybarra, the CEO of Citigroup's institutional clients group, will leave in the first half of next year, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.
The 36-year Citi veteran leads the Wall Street firm's banking, markets and services businesses. He helped to establish it as a "powerhouse in fixed income," CEO Jane Fraser wrote in a memo to staff.
Ybarra joined Citi in Madrid in 1987 as a management associate and subsequently worked in Mexico, Singapore, London and New York.

articles.title: Citi Analysts Say China's Mortgage Rate Push Is Concern at Banks
articles.excerpt: (Bloomberg) — China's use of stronger language in its latest pledge for banks to cut mortgage rates may lead to
articles.summary:
(Bloomberg) — China's use of stronger language in its latest pledge for banks to cut mortgage rates may lead to more pressure on margins, according to Citigroup Inc. analysts.
The nation's central bank seems to have adopted 'harsher-than-expected' wording that could be interpreted as requiring large and commercial banks to reduce existing home lending rates, Citigroup analysts led by Judy Zhang wrote in a report Tuesday. It may spark concerns over their burden of performing a 'national service' and lower margins, they wrote.

articles.title: Citigroup, Wells Fargo, PNC: Undervalued Dividend Growers
articles.author: MarketBeat
articles.excerpt: If you're exploring dividend stocks, you can adopt various strategies. You might seek out high-yield stocks, or those with consistent payouts and robust financial conditions, or companies with a track…
articles.summary:
If you're exploring dividend stocks, you can adopt various strategies. You might seek out high-yield stocks, or those with consistent payouts and robust financial conditions, or companies with a track record of boosting dividends. 
Those last categories often overlap: Companies with steady histories of increasing shareholder payouts typically have steady, reliable revenue and earnings, and solid margins. 
Here's a look at three stocks from the banking industry that are raising dividends. After getting clobbered in March, due to the crisis in regional banks, larger banks have been slowly edging their way higher.

articles.title: Citigroup CEO of institutional clients group Paco Ybarra to leave
articles.author: Lananh Nguyen
articles.excerpt: Paco Ybarra, the CEO of Citigroup's institutional clients group, will leave in the first half of next year, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.
articles.summary:
The logo for Citibank is seen on the trading floor at the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) in Manhattan, New York City, U.S., August 3, 2021. REUTERS/Andrew Kelly/File photo

NEW YORK, Aug 3 (Reuters) - Paco Ybarra, the CEO of Citigroup's (C.N) institutional clients group, will leave in the first half of next year, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.

The 36-year Citi veteran leads the Wall Street firm's banking, markets and services businesses. He helped to establish it as a "powerhouse in fixed income," CEO Jane Fraser wrote in a memo to staff.
articles.authors: An M.Sc. In Finance,Economic Policy The University,Financial Markets,Lananh Nguyen,London,Thomson Reuters

articles.title: Big Bank Stocks Slide Following Regional Downgrades
articles.author: Jack Pitcher
articles.excerpt: Shares of Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase and Citigroup were all down 2% or more after Moody's cut the credit rating of 10 smaller U.S. banks and said it was reviewing the ratings of six larger ones. The ratings firm said the Federal Reserve's campaign to lift interest rates to combat inflation "continues to have a material impact on the US banking system's funding and its economic capital."
articles.summary: Shares of Bank of America, JPMorgan Chase and Citigroup were all down 2% or more after Moody's cut the credit rating of 10 smaller U.S. banks and said it was reviewing the ratings of six larger ones. The ratings firm said the Federal Reserve's campaign to lift interest rates to combat inflation "continues to have a material impact on the US banking system's funding and its economic capital."

articles.title: For Ex-Citi CEO, Life After Wall Street Is a Wyoming Ski Resort
articles.author: Jennifer Surane
articles.excerpt: It's all downhill from here for Mike Corbat, and that's just how he wants it.
articles.summary:
It's all downhill from here for Mike Corbat, and that's just how he wants it.

Corbat, the former chief executive officer of Citigroup Inc., and Eric Macy, a former Jefferies Financial Group Inc. banker, are among a group of investors acquiring Jackson Hole Mountain Resort in Teton Village, Wyoming. The sellers — Jay, Connie and Betty Kemmerer — have owned the property since 1992.

articles.title: Citigroup CEO of institutional clients group Paco Ybarra to leave
articles.author: Reuters
articles.excerpt: By Lananh Nguyen NEW YORK (Reuters) - Paco Ybarra, the CEO of Citigroup's institutional clients group, will leave in the first half of next year,
articles.summary:
By Lananh Nguyen


NEW YORK (Reuters) – Paco Ybarra, the CEO of Citigroup's institutional clients group, will leave in the first half of next year, according to an internal memo seen by Reuters.


The 36-year Citi veteran leads the Wall Street firm's banking, markets and services businesses. He helped to establish it as a 'powerhouse in fixed income,' CEO Jane Fraser wrote in a memo to staff.


Ybarra joined Citi in Madrid in 1987 as a management associate and subsequently worked in Mexico, Singapore, London and New York.

Peter is survived by his loving wife, Eldonna, and sons David (Lynne McGurrin) of Clermont, FL, Kevin (Ana Zeledon) of Clermont, FL, and daughters, Kristin (Dan Morrissey) of Richmond, VA, and Jennifer (JB) Wing of Hypoluxo, FL, as well as grandchildren, Emily Morrissey, Patrick (PJ) Morrissey, Braden Wing, and Megan and Rylie Wing. articles.title: How The Pieces Add Up: IWX Targets $77
articles.author: Am Edt
articles.excerpt: Looking at the underlying holdings of the ETFs in our coverage universe at ETF Channel, we have compared the trading price of each holding against the average analyst 12-month forward target price, and computed the weighted average implied analyst target price for the ETF itsel
articles.summary:
Looking at the underlying holdings of the ETFs in our coverage universe at ETF Channel, we have compared the trading price of each holding against the average analyst 12-month forward target price, and computed the weighted average implied analyst target price for the ETF itself. For the iShares Russell Top 200 Value ETF (Symbol: IWX), we found that the implied analyst target price for the ETF based upon its underlying holdings is $77.48 per unit.

The week began with a number of strategists lifting their forecasts for the Citigroup raised its mid-2024 forecast to 5000 from 4400, while Piper Sandler hiked its to 4825 from 4625. It's probably not a coincidence that the stock market had a difficult week, with the S&P 500 dropping 2.3%, the falling 1.1%, and the dipping 2.8%.

articles.title: Europe's Latest Batch of Earnings a Saving Grace for Markets
articles.author: Michael Msika
articles.excerpt: What looked like a dismal earnings season in Europe just a week ago has taken a surprising turn for the better.
articles.summary:
What looked like a dismal earnings season in Europe just a week ago has taken a surprising turn for the better.

'The current reporting season has been reasonably good, with a majority of companies beating expectations,' Citigroup Inc. strategists led by Beata Manthey wrote in a note on Friday, while raising their earnings outlook for 2023 and 2024 as risks to the economic outlook are more balanced. 'Soft-landing scenarios look plausible, but tightening credit conditions remain a key headwind.'

articles.excerpt: Stocks have soared, and Wall Street is raising its S&P 500 targets. The week began with a number of strategists lifting their forecasts for the Citigroup raised its mid-2024 forecast to 5000 from…
articles.summary: Stocks have soared, and Wall Street is raising its S&P 500 targets. The week began with a number of strategists lifting their forecasts for the Citigroup raised its mid-2024 forecast to 5000 from 4400, while Piper Sandler hiked its to 4825 from 4625. It's probably not a coincidence that the stock market had a difficult week, with the S&P 500 dropping 2.3%, the falling 1.1%, and the dipping 2.8%.

articles.title: Wintrust Business Minute: O'Hare is down to 4th busiest airport in the U.S.
articles.author: Michael Piff
articles.excerpt: Steve Grzanich has the business news of the day with the Wintrust Business Minute. O'Hare Airport used to be the busiest airport in the world. Now it's down to 4th busiest in the U.S., according to the latest ranking by Airports Council International. Last year, O'Hare's total passenger count trailed Atlanta, Dallas-Fort Worth and Denver […]
articles.summary:
Steve Grzanich has the business news of the day with the Wintrust Business Minute.

O'Hare Airport used to be the busiest airport in the world. Now it's down to 4th busiest in the U.S., according to the latest ranking by Airports Council International. Last year, O'Hare's total passenger count trailed Atlanta, Dallas-Fort Worth and Denver as it struggled to rebuild its pre-pandemic passenger loads. In 2019, O'Hare came in third behind Atlanta and Los Angeles. The ranking shows more people flying international versus domestic.

articles.title: SocGen Explores Strategic Options for Asset Custodian Unit
articles.author: Alexandre Rajbhandari
articles.excerpt: Societe Generale SA is exploring strategic options for its asset custodian unit, including a sale, as part a plan to boost its valuation by getting rid of poorly performing businesses.
articles.summary:
By , Jan-Henrik Foerster, and Steven Arons

Societe Generale SA is exploring strategic options for its asset custodian unit, including a sale, as part a plan to boost its valuation by getting rid of poorly performing businesses.

The Paris-based bank is working with Citigroup Inc. on a potential deal for Societe Generale Securities Services, also known as SGSS, people familiar with the plan said, asking not to be identified discussing private matters. The unit could be valued at more than €1 billion ($1.

articles.summary: SAN ANTONIO, August 09, 2023--(BUSINESS WIRE)--NuStar Energy L.P. The Partnership intends to use the net proceeds from the offering to redeem outstanding Series D Cumulative Convertible Preferred Units and to pay related fees and expenses.

articles.title: Citi investment bank head Paco Ybarra to leave after 36 years at lender
articles.author: Stephen Gandel in New York
articles.excerpt: Paco Ybarra, Citigroup's investment banking head and leader of the bank's biggest business unit, is to leave the company in the most significant management departure since Jane Fraser became chief…
articles.summary: Paco Ybarra, Citigroup's investment banking head and leader of the bank's biggest business unit, is to leave the company in the most significant management departure since Jane Fraser became chief executive more than two years ago. Ybarra, a 36-year veteran of Citi, joined the bank as a junior manager in Madrid before climbing the ladder to become head of debt trading. In 2019, Citi's then-chief executive Michael Corbat named him as head of Citi's large institutional client group, which also includes the bank's transaction services business.

articles.title: China Rally Is Just an Opportunity to Sell for Many Global Funds
articles.author: Henry Ren
articles.excerpt: The nascent rebound in Chinese shares is at risk of becoming yet another false dawn as foreign investors seem unconvinced that policymakers can revive a faltering economy.
articles.summary:
The nascent rebound in Chinese shares is at risk of becoming yet another false dawn as foreign investors seem unconvinced that policymakers can revive a faltering economy.

US and European long-only fund managers were net sellers of Chinese and Hong Kong stocks in July, according to Morgan Stanley, which is now advising clients to take profits on the recent rally and has downgraded China to equalweight. The FTSE China A50 Index the only one of 10 major global equity benchmarks tracked by Citigroup Inc.

articles.title: Citigroup among new tenants planning move to Schaumburg Corporate Center
articles.author: Eric Peterson
articles.excerpt: Global banking firm Citigroup will occupy 49,400 square feet across two floors at the Schaumburg Corporate Center, leading the way among recent successes high-end office properties in the village have…
articles.summary:
Global banking firm Citigroup will occupy 49,400 square feet across two floors at the Schaumburg Corporate Center, leading the way among recent successes high-end office properties in the village have had in attracting new tenants in the post-pandemic market.
 
The three-building, million-square foot property at the corner of Meacham and Higgins roads, south of Woodfield Mall, has signed 89,000 square feet of new leases in recent months, as well as 65,000 square feet of renewals.
 
Citigroup's relocation from a significantly larger space in Elk Grove Village demonstrates a shift in the market, with firms downsizing to higher quality spaces with amenities.

articles.title: NuStar Energy L.P. Announces Public Offering of Common Units
articles.author: Business Wire
articles.excerpt: NuStar Energy L.P. announced today that it plans to conduct an offering of 12,000,000 common units pursuant to an effective shelf registration statement previously filed with the Securities and...
articles.summary: NuStar Energy L.P. (NYSE:NS) (the 'Partnership') announced today that it plans to conduct an offering of 12,000,000 common units pursuant to an effective shelf registration statement previously filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission ('SEC'). The Partnership will grant the underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to 1,800,000 additional common units. The Partnership intends to use the net proceeds from the offering to redeem outstanding Series D Cumulative Convertible Preferred Units and to pay related fees and expenses.

articles.title: Societe Generale Considers Sale of Asset-Custodian Unit SGSS, Bloomberg Reports
articles.author: Dow Jones
articles.excerpt: --Societe Generale is considering strategic options for its asset custodian-unit Societe Generale Securities Services, including a potential sale, Bloomberg reports. --The French bank is...
articles.summary:
--Societe Generale is considering strategic options for its asset custodian-unit Societe Generale Securities Services, including a potential sale, Bloomberg reports. 
 --The French bank is currently working with Citigroup on a potential deal as part of efforts to dispose of poorly performing businesses, the news agency says, citing unnamed sources. 
 --The unit could be valued at over EUR1 billion ($1.09 billion), according to Bloomberg. 
 Full story: 
https://shorturl.at/HIRUX
 Write to Giulia Petroni at giulia.

articles.excerpt: NuStar Energy L.P. announced today the pricing of an offering of 13,000,000 common units for gross proceeds of approximately $199.6 million. The Partnership has granted the underwriters a 30-day...
articles.summary: NuStar Energy L.P. (NYSE:NS) (the 'Partnership') announced today the pricing of an offering of 13,000,000 common units for gross proceeds of approximately $199.6 million. The Partnership has granted the underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to 1,950,000 additional common units. The offering is scheduled to close Friday, August 11, 2023. The Partnership intends to use the net proceeds from the offering to redeem outstanding Series D Cumulative Convertible Preferred Units and to pay related fees and expenses.

articles.title: US Bank Stocks Drop After Moody's Downgrade
articles.author: Reuters
articles.excerpt: US News is a recognized leader in college, grad school, hospital, mutual fund, and car rankings. Track elected officials, research health conditions, and find news you can use in politics, business, health, and education.
articles.summary:
(Reuters) - Shares of U.S. banks fell in premarket trading on Tuesday after Moody's downgrade of 10 mid-sized lenders reignited investor concerns about challenges facing the banking industry.

The rating agency said rising funding costs, possible decline in deposit levels and weaker profitability pose risks to the banking sector, which went through a crisis earlier this year after the collapse of three lenders.

"The Moody's announcement is a wake-up call," Stuart Cole, chief macro economist at Equiti Capital, said.

articles.title: Illinois feared losing to Wall Street banks over muni price-fixing case
articles.author: Crain's Chicago Business
articles.excerpt: Not settling before the case went to trial 'would almost certainly have resulted in a loss,' said a filing by state Attorney General Kwame Raoul.
articles.summary:
Edelweiss alleged that a group of banks inflated interest rates on bonds that finance public projects to discourage investors from returning them for cash and also colluded in setting the rates. Bank of America Corp., Barclays Capital Inc., BMO Financial Corp., William Blair & Co. LLC, Citigroup Inc., Fifth Third Bancorp, JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Morgan Stanley were expected to go to trial in Illinois on Aug. 7 for this case.
While Illinois agreed to settle on July 17, this is the first time any state has defended its decision to do so.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.excerpt: The rating agency said rising funding costs, possible decline in deposit levels and weaker profitability pose risks to the banking sector, which went through a crisis earlier this year after the…
articles.summary:
(Reuters) - Shares of U.S. banks fell in premarket trading on Tuesday after Moody's downgrade of 10 mid-sized lenders reignited investor concerns about challenges facing the banking industry.
The rating agency said rising funding costs, possible decline in deposit levels and weaker profitability pose risks to the banking sector, which went through a crisis earlier this year after the collapse of three lenders.
"The Moody's announcement is a wake-up call," Stuart Cole, chief macro economist at Equiti Capital, said.

articles.title: Citigroup's Asia family office clients poised to grow 25% in 2023
articles.author: Xie Yu
articles.excerpt: Citigroup's Asia family office business expects a 25% increase in clients this year, the U.S. bank's regional head of its family office advisory business said, as Singapore and Hong Kong vie to…
articles.summary:
By Xie Yu
HONG KONG (Reuters) - Citigroup's Asia family office business expects a 25% increase in clients this year, the U.S. bank's regional head of its family office advisory business said, as Singapore and Hong Kong vie to attract more wealth.
The momentum builds off a strong 2022 when the bank saw client numbers increase by around 50% year-on-year in Asia from a modest base in the preceding year, Faye Ong told Reuters in an interview.
Global banks have been beefing up family office arms in Asia, as demand continues to surge among rich Asians wanting to set up private investment vehicles and plan for business succession.

articles.title: US bank stocks drop after Moody's downgrade
articles.author: Reuters
articles.excerpt: Shares of U.S. banks fell in premarket trading on Tuesday after Moody's downgrade of 10 mid-sized lenders reignited investor concerns about challenges facing the banking industry. The...
articles.summary:
Aug 8 (Reuters) - Shares of U.S. banks fell in premarket
trading on Tuesday after Moody's downgrade of 10 mid-sized
lenders reignited investor concerns about challenges facing the
banking industry.
The rating agency said rising funding costs, possible
decline in deposit levels and weaker profitability pose risks to
the banking sector, which went through a crisis earlier this
year after the collapse of three lenders.
"The Moody's announcement is a wake-up call," Stuart Cole,
chief macro economist at Equiti Capital, said.

DENVER, Aug. 8, 2023 /PRNewswire/ -- Gates Industrial Corporation plc (NYSE: GTES, "Gates" or the "Company") announced today that certain selling stockholders affiliated with Blackstone Inc. (the "Selling Stockholders") have commenced a secondary offering of 15,000,000 of Gates' ordinary shares (the "Offering"). In connection with the Offering, the Selling Stockholders intend to grant to the underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to 2,250,000 additional ordinary shares.
Gates is not offering any ordinary shares in the Offering and will not receive any proceeds from the sale of ordinary shares in the Offering.

articles.title: Citigroup is working on a plan to fill Paco Ybarra's big shoes
articles.author: National Editor
articles.excerpt: Ybarra, who leads the megabank's sprawling institutional clients group, plans to depart in the first half of next year. Citi says it's assessing how to allocate his responsibilities.
articles.summary:
Paco Ybarra, a 36-year Citigroup veteran and a top deputy to CEO Jane Fraser, plans to leave the company in the first half of next year.
 
 
 
Citigroup says it's assessing how to allocate the responsibilities of Paco Ybarra, the head of its sprawling institutional clients group, who plans to leave the bank in the first half of 2024.
Ybarra, 61, is a 36-year Citi veteran and a top deputy to CEO Jane Fraser. Since 2019, he has led the bank's institutional business, which includes trading, investment banking, corporate banking and the treasury and trade division.

articles.title: Wells Fargo, BNP to pay millions in U.S. fines in WhatsApp probes
articles.author: Brent Lewin Bloomberg
articles.excerpt: Under settlements with the SEC, Wells Fargo and BNP Paribas will pay millions of dollars in penalties for employees using unofficial communications like WhatsApp. In all 11 firms agreed to pay…
articles.summary:
Wells Fargo and BNP Paribas will pay millions of dollars in penalties for employees using unofficial communications like WhatsApp to conduct business as the Securities and Exchange Commission deepens its crackdown on how Wall Street keeps records.
Wells Fargo units agreed to pay $125 million to settle the cases and BNP will pay $35 million, the SEC said on Tuesday. In all 11 firms agreed to pay penalties, including a Bank of Montreal unit and a Mizuho Financial Group securities arm, to Wall Street's main regulator.

articles.title: Modi May Give Farm Handouts as Food Export Bans Hit Rural India
articles.author: Anup Roy
articles.excerpt: Prime Minister Narendra Modi may offer handouts to Indian farmers ahead of the elections as food commodity export bans to control inflation begin to hurt incomes and could cost him some votes.
articles.summary:
(Bloomberg) -- Prime Minister Narendra Modi may offer handouts to Indian farmers ahead of the elections as food commodity export bans to control inflation begin to hurt incomes and could cost him some votes.  
Modi's administration banned exports of some rice varieties last month along with wheat in 2023 and imposed curbs on stockpiling some food staples with an eye to keeping inflation in check. There's cause for a concern: ruling parties in the past have lost the national vote because they couldn't control the price of essential items like onions.

articles.title: 3 Preferred Stock Funds Yielding Up To 9.4%
articles.author: Brett Owens
articles.excerpt: Is there still a chance to buy the bank dip? You bet—with nifty yields up to 9.4%!
articles.summary:
We're going to avoid the regional lenders, which pains me to say because I love banking with the small guys. But I'm not looking to own them as the economy slows down.

No, nothing personal, but I'll take the banking behemoths. None of them yield 9.4%, of course, but we engineer these payouts easily via their preferred dividends.

Preferred stocks are often referred to as stock-bond 'hybrids' given that they share some characteristics of each asset. A quick breakdown:

They represent ownership in a company (like a stock)
They typically don't offer voting rights (like a bond)
They pay dividends (like a stock)
Their dividends are typically fixed at a certain level (like a bond)
They can rise and decline based on the performance of the underlying company (like a stock)
But they tend to be much more stable, trading around a 'par value' like a bond)

Most noteworthy, for income fanatics like you and I, is that their dividends are plump.

articles.title: BofA holds No. 1 position in corporate bond underwriting, with Wells Fargo moving up to No. 2 as the overall pie shrinks
articles.author: Steve Gelsi
articles.excerpt: Overall corporate bond issuance fell to $55.4 billion YTD 2023 through July from $137.5 bln in 2022, although deal-making has picked up recently.
articles.summary:
Bank of America Corp.'s investment bank BofA Securities remained the top corporate debt issuer in 2023 as of Aug. 1, while Wells Fargo Securities LLC has bumped JPMorgan Chase & Co. for the No. 2 slot, according to S&P Global Market Intelligence data.
 
All told, year-to-date U.S. corporate debt offerings handled by the largest Wall Street banks have fallen sharply to $65.8 billion as of July 31, from the corresponding year-ago total of $137.5 billion, amid a lack of deal-making in 2023. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 S&P Global Market Intelligence 
 
 
 
 
However, some encouraging signs have surfaced as spreads on high-yield corporate bonds over comparable Treasurys have tightened in recent weeks.

articles.title: GATES ANNOUNCES SECONDARY OFFERING OF 15,000,000 ORDINARY SHARES
articles.summary:
DENVER, Aug. 8, 2023 /PRNewswire/ -- Gates Industrial Corporation plc (NYSE: GTES, "Gates" or the "Company") announced today that certain selling stockholders affiliated with Blackstone Inc. (the "Selling Stockholders") have commenced a secondary offering of 15,000,000 of Gates' ordinary shares (the "Offering"). In connection with the Offering, the Selling Stockholders intend to grant to the underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to 2,250,000 additional ordinary shares.

Gates Industrial Corporation (PRNewswire)

Gates is not offering any ordinary shares in the Offering and will not receive any proceeds from the sale of ordinary shares in the Offering.

articles.excerpt: (Bloomberg) -- Wells Fargo & Co. and BNP Paribas SA will pay millions of dollars in penalties for employees using unofficial communications like WhatsApp to conduct business as the Securities and Exchange Commission deepens its crackdown on how Wall Street keeps records.Most Read from BloombergMusk Says He May Need Surgery, Will Get MRI on Back and NeckMoody's Cuts US Banks on Mounting Funding Costs, Office RiskEastern US Prepares for a ‘Potent' Storm System: Weather WatchThe Global South Breaks
articles.summary:
(Bloomberg) -- Wells Fargo & Co. and BNP Paribas SA will pay millions of dollars in penalties for employees using unofficial communications like WhatsApp to conduct business as the Securities and Exchange Commission deepens its crackdown on how Wall Street keeps records.


Moody's Cuts US Banks on Mounting Funding Costs, Office Risk
Eastern US Prepares for a ‘Potent' Storm System: Weather Watch


Wells Fargo units agreed to pay $125 million to settle the cases and BNP will pay $35 million, the SEC said on Tuesday.

articles.title: Citigroup's Asia family office clients poised to grow 25% in 2023
articles.author: Reuters
articles.excerpt: By Xie Yu HONG KONG (Reuters) - Citigroup's Asia family office business expects a 25% increase in clients this year, the U.S. bank's regional head of its
articles.summary:
By Xie Yu


HONG KONG (Reuters) – Citigroup's Asia family office business expects a 25% increase in clients this year, the U.S. bank's regional head of its family office advisory business said, as Singapore and Hong Kong vie to attract more wealth. 


The momentum builds off a strong 2022 when the bank saw client numbers increase by around 50% year-on-year in Asia from a modest base in the preceding year, Faye Ong told Reuters in an interview.


Global banks have been beefing up family office arms in Asia, as demand continues to surge among rich Asians wanting to set up private investment vehicles and plan for business succession.

articles.title: Citigroup's Asia family office clients poised to grow 25% in 2023
articles.author: Syndicated Content
articles.excerpt: By Xie Yu HONG KONG (Reuters) - Citigroup's Asia family office business expects a 25% increase in clients this year, the U.S. bank's regional head of ...
articles.summary:
By Xie Yu
HONG KONG (Reuters) – Citigroup's Asia family office business expects a 25% increase in clients this year, the U.S. bank's regional head of its family office advisory business said, as Singapore and Hong Kong vie to attract more wealth.
The momentum builds off a strong 2022 when the bank saw client numbers increase by around 50% year-on-year in Asia from a modest base in the preceding year, Faye Ong told Reuters in an interview.
Global banks have been beefing up family office arms in Asia, as demand continues to surge among rich Asians wanting to set up private investment vehicles and plan for business succession.

articles.title: Coinbase to Buy Back Junk Bonds as Bitcoin Hovers Near 2023 High
articles.author: Olivia Raimonde
articles.excerpt: Coinbase Global Inc. is offering to buy back some of its outstanding junk bonds as the world's largest cryptocurrency trades near its highest value of the year, according to a statement Monday.
articles.summary:
(Bloomberg) -- Coinbase Global Inc. is offering to buy back some of its outstanding junk bonds as the world's largest cryptocurrency trades near its highest value of the year, according to a statement Monday. 
The crypto exchange is offering to redeem as much as $150 million of its 3.625% notes due October 2031. Investors who wish to tender will be eligible to receive between $615 and $645 per $1,000 of principal, according to the statement. The offer will expire Sept. 1 at 11:59 p.m. New York time.

articles.title: Why Dell Stock Is Moving Today
articles.author: Ryan Gustafson
articles.excerpt: Dell Technologies Inc. (NYSE: DELL) shares are trading higher Tuesday after Morgan Stanley said its checks indicate the company is ramping its AI server builds.
articles.summary:
Dell Technologies Inc.
 
DELL
 shares are trading higher Tuesday after 
Morgan Stanley
 said its checks indicate the company is ramping its AI server builds.
 
What To Know: 
Morgan Stanley raised its bull case valuation on the stock from $81 to $84. The focus of the case is on DELL's leveraging of generative AI technology, with the company recently placing build orders for 15k to 25k AI servers in CY23 to 24.
The firm said its supply chain checks suggest the company is ramping its AI server builds with an estimated 15-25k AI server build orders in 2023-2024.

articles.title: Why did Expedia stock jump today? Citi's price adjustment (NASDAQ:EXPE)
articles.author: Christiana Sciaudone
articles.excerpt: Expedia jumped 4.2% on Monday after Citigroup adjusted its price target on the stock to $115 from $105. Read more.
articles.summary:
Thomas Barwick
 
Expedia Group (
NASDAQ:
EXPE
) jumped 
4.2%
 on Monday after Citigroup adjusted its price target on the stock to $115 from $105.
 
The firm maintained a Neutral rating on shares.
 
Last week, the online travel company reported gross bookings in Q2 that missed expectations. While Expedia's (
EXPE
) revenue of $3.36B was roughly in-line with estimates, the closely-watched gross bookings metric was $27.32B vs. $28.89B consensus. Booked room nights were up 9%, and lodging bookings rose 7%.

articles.title: Land is expensive but home builders are making it work, says Citigroup
articles.author: Tan Kw
articles.excerpt: Land is expensive but home builders are making it work, says Citigroup
articles.summary:
NEW YORK: Home builders are not being held back by 'stubbornly elevated' land costs, according to Citigroup analysts.


 The sector is well-positioned for further volume growth into next year, analysts led by Anthony Pettinari said in a note to clients.


 D.R. Horton Inc and PulteGroup Inc saw increased demand this quarter, with net order volumes rising 37% and 24% year-over-year, respectively.


 Last week, the sector outperformed the broader market, climbing 1.9% versus the S&P 500's 1% advance, as builders continued to post better-than-expected earnings.

articles.title: Citigroup's Asia family office clients poised to grow 25% in 2023
articles.author: Syndicated Content
articles.excerpt: By Xie Yu HONG KONG (Reuters) - Citigroup's Asia family office business expects a 25% increase in clients this year, the U.S. bank's regional head of ...
articles.summary:
By Xie Yu
HONG KONG (Reuters) – Citigroup's Asia family office business expects a 25% increase in clients this year, the U.S. bank's regional head of its family office advisory business said, as Singapore and Hong Kong vie to attract more wealth.
The momentum builds off a strong 2022 when the bank saw client numbers increase by around 50% year-on-year in Asia from a modest base in the preceding year, Faye Ong told Reuters in an interview.
Global banks have been beefing up family office arms in Asia, as demand continues to surge among rich Asians wanting to set up private investment vehicles and plan for business succession.

articles.title: Wall Street's Return-to-Office Crackdown Could Backfire
articles.author: Lananh Nguyen
articles.excerpt: Financial firms that enforce strict return-to-office mandates could drive employees to leave, according to a study published Tuesday by accounting firm Deloitte.
articles.summary:
Financial firms that enforce strict return-to-office mandates could drive employees to leave, according to a study published Tuesday by accounting firm Deloitte.

Of 700 financial executives surveyed by Deloitte, 66% who worked remotely part time said they would likely quit if they were ordered to return to the office five days a week.

"Professionals - men and women alike - whose work and personal lives have been reshaped by remote work largely want to maintain flexibility even if it comes at a personal cost," Deloitte said.

articles.title: US bank stocks drop after Moody's downgrade
articles.author: Reuters
articles.excerpt: (Reuters) - Shares of U.S. banks fell in premarket trading on Tuesday after Moody's downgrade of 10 mid-sized lenders reignited investor concerns about
articles.summary:
(Reuters) – Shares of U.S. banks fell in premarket trading on Tuesday after Moody's downgrade of 10 mid-sized lenders reignited investor concerns about challenges facing the banking industry.


The rating agency said rising funding costs, possible decline in deposit levels and weaker profitability pose risks to the banking sector, which went through a crisis earlier this year after the collapse of three lenders.


'The Moody's announcement is a wake-up call,' Stuart Cole, chief macro economist at Equiti Capital, said.

articles.title: Finance firms' return-to-office crackdown could backfire
articles.author: Lananh Nguyen
articles.excerpt: Financial firms that enforce strict return-to-office mandates could drive employees to leave, according to a study published Tuesday by accounting firm Deloitte. Of 700 financial executives surveyed…
articles.summary:
By Lananh Nguyen
NEW YORK, Aug 8 (Reuters) - Financial firms that enforce strict return-to-office mandates could drive employees to leave, according to a study published Tuesday by accounting firm Deloitte.
Of 700 financial executives surveyed by Deloitte, 66% who worked remotely part time said they would likely quit if they were ordered to return to the office five days a week.
"Professionals - men and women alike - whose work and personal lives have been reshaped by remote work largely want to maintain flexibility even if it comes at a personal cost," Deloitte said.

articles.title: Citigroup's Asia family office clients poised to grow 25% in 2023
articles.author: Syndicated Content
articles.excerpt: By Xie Yu HONG KONG (Reuters) - Citigroup's Asia family office business expects a 25% increase in clients this year, the U.S. bank's regional head of ...
articles.summary:
By Xie Yu
HONG KONG (Reuters) – Citigroup's Asia family office business expects a 25% increase in clients this year, the U.S. bank's regional head of its family office advisory business said, as Singapore and Hong Kong vie to attract more wealth.
The momentum builds off a strong 2022 when the bank saw client numbers increase by around 50% year-on-year in Asia from a modest base in the preceding year, Faye Ong told Reuters in an interview.
Global banks have been beefing up family office arms in Asia, as demand continues to surge among rich Asians wanting to set up private investment vehicles and plan for business succession.

articles.title: Square Enix Drops 15% After ‘Final Fantasy' and Mobile Setback
articles.author: Vlad Savov
articles.excerpt: Square Enix Holdings Co. shares suffered their worst intraday drop in almost three years after the company reported a 79% drop in operating profit.
articles.summary:
The information you requested is not available at this time, please check back again soon.
 
 
 Video
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Vlad Savov and Takashi Mochizuki
, 
Bloomberg News
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
(Bloomberg) -- Square Enix Holdings Co. shares suffered their worst intraday drop in almost three years after the company reported a 79% drop in operating profit.
Hopes for the well-reviewed Final Fantasy XVI to boost sales were dashed by the company's downbeat earnings report Friday, driving the stock down as much as 15% in Tokyo on Monday.

articles.author: Lisa Levin
articles.excerpt: Thoughtworks Holding, Inc. (NASDAQ: TWKS) reported worse-than-expected second-quarter financial results and issued third-quarter guidance below estimates.
articles.summary:
by 
Lisa Levin
, Benzinga Editor
 
August 9, 2023 7:58 AM
 | 
 1 min read 
Thoughtworks Holding, Inc. 
 
TWKS
 reported worse-than-expected second-quarter financial results and issued third-quarter guidance below estimates.
Thoughtworks posted adjusted earnings of 3 cents per share, 
missing market estimates
 of 4 cents per share. The company's sales came in at $287.21 million, versus expectations of $301.50 million.
Thoughtworks said it sees third-quarter revenue of $275 million to $285 million, versus estimates of $326.

articles.title: Sony Falls Most in a Year on Pessimism Over Smartphone Demand
articles.author: Takashi Mochizuki
articles.excerpt: Sony Group Corp.'s shares plunged after the electronics and entertainment group's outlook missed expectations and warned the smartphone market may not recover until next year.
articles.summary:
The information you requested is not available at this time, please check back again soon.
 
 
 Video
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Takashi Mochizuki
, 
Bloomberg News
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
(Bloomberg) -- Sony Group Corp.'s shares plunged after the electronics and entertainment group's outlook missed expectations and warned the smartphone market may not recover until next year.
Sony's stock price dropped as much as 6.5% during Thursday morning trade in Tokyo, the biggest intraday fall in a year. 
Sony is a key supplier of image sensors to Apple Inc.

articles.title: Morgan Stanley Reaches 70% Of $1 Trillion Esg Funding Goal
articles.author: MENAFN
articles.excerpt: Bloomberg Morgan Stanley said it's more than two thirds of the way towards achieving its target to finance $1 trillion of low carbon and sust
articles.summary:
Morgan Stanley said it's more than two thirds of the way towards achieving its target to finance $1 trillion of low carbon and sustainability investments by the end of the decade.

The Wall Street firm said in an ESG report this week that it has allocated $700 billion of financing, with more than $550 billion of that directed to green activities.

The bank said numerous groups contributed to the program, including its securitized products, commodities and wealth management divisions. The funds went to areas including clean energy, carbon removal and social housing.

articles.title: Citigroup's Asia family office clients poised to grow 25% in 2023
articles.author: Syndicated Content
articles.excerpt: By Xie Yu HONG KONG (Reuters) - Citigroup's Asia family office business expects a 25% increase in clients this year, the U.S. bank's regional head of ...
articles.summary:
By Xie Yu
HONG KONG (Reuters) – Citigroup's Asia family office business expects a 25% increase in clients this year, the U.S. bank's regional head of its family office advisory business said, as Singapore and Hong Kong vie to attract more wealth.
The momentum builds off a strong 2022 when the bank saw client numbers increase by around 50% year-on-year in Asia from a modest base in the preceding year, Faye Ong told Reuters in an interview.
Global banks have been beefing up family office arms in Asia, as demand continues to surge among rich Asians wanting to set up private investment vehicles and plan for business succession.

articles.title: US bank stocks drop after Moody's downgrade
articles.author: Syndicated Content
articles.excerpt: (Reuters) - Shares of U.S. banks fell in premarket trading on Tuesday after Moody's downgrade of 10 mid-sized lenders reignited investor concerns abou...
articles.summary:
(Reuters) – Shares of U.S. banks fell in premarket trading on Tuesday after Moody's downgrade of 10 mid-sized lenders reignited investor concerns about challenges facing the banking industry.

The rating agency said rising funding costs, possible decline in deposit levels and weaker profitability pose risks to the banking sector, which went through a crisis earlier this year after the collapse of three lenders.

'The Moody's announcement is a wake-up call,' Stuart Cole, chief macro economist at Equiti Capital, said.

articles.title: DBS to Increase Investments, Hiring in China's Greater Bay Area
articles.author: Lisa Du
articles.excerpt: DBS Group Holdings Ltd., Southeast Asia's largest bank, will increase investment and hiring in China's Greater Bay Area as it expects growth in the region to outpace the rest of the country, according…
articles.summary:
(Bloomberg) -- DBS Group Holdings Ltd., Southeast Asia's largest bank, will increase investment and hiring in China's Greater Bay Area as it expects growth in the region to outpace the rest of the country, according to the lender's head of North Asia.
'There's no reason not to be optimistic about the future and the long-term prospects of China,' Sebastian Paredes, who is also the chief executive officer of DBS Bank in Hong Kong, said on Bloomberg TV Wednesday. 
Paredes said he viewed the China operations holistically and it would have a positive effect on the rest of DBS' businesses around Asia.

articles.title: Citigroup's Asia family office clients poised to grow 25% in 2023
articles.author: Syndicated Content
articles.excerpt: By Xie Yu HONG KONG (Reuters) - Citigroup's Asia family office business expects a 25% increase in clients this year, the U.S. bank's regional head of ...
articles.summary:
By Xie Yu
HONG KONG (Reuters) – Citigroup's Asia family office business expects a 25% increase in clients this year, the U.S. bank's regional head of its family office advisory business said, as Singapore and Hong Kong vie to attract more wealth.
The momentum builds off a strong 2022 when the bank saw client numbers increase by around 50% year-on-year in Asia from a modest base in the preceding year, Faye Ong told Reuters in an interview.
Global banks have been beefing up family office arms in Asia, as demand continues to surge among rich Asians wanting to set up private investment vehicles and plan for business succession.

articles.title: US bank stocks drop after Moody's downgrade
articles.author: Syndicated Content
articles.excerpt: (Reuters) - Shares of U.S. banks fell in premarket trading on Tuesday after Moody's downgrade of 10 mid-sized lenders reignited investor concerns abou...
articles.summary:
(Reuters) – Shares of U.S. banks fell in premarket trading on Tuesday after Moody's downgrade of 10 mid-sized lenders reignited investor concerns about challenges facing the banking industry.
The rating agency said rising funding costs, possible decline in deposit levels and weaker profitability pose risks to the banking sector, which went through a crisis earlier this year after the collapse of three lenders.
'The Moody's announcement is a wake-up call,' Stuart Cole, chief macro economist at Equiti Capital, said.

articles.excerpt: StockNews.com upgraded shares of América Móvil (NYSE:AMX – Free Report) from a buy rating to a strong-buy rating in a report published on Tuesday. AMX has been the topic of a number of other research reports. Scotiabank downgraded América Móvil from an outperform rating to a sector perform rating in a report on Wednesday, July […]
articles.summary:
StockNews.com upgraded shares of América Móvil (NYSE:AMX – Free Report) from a buy rating to a strong-buy rating in a report published on Tuesday.

AMX has been the topic of a number of other research reports. Scotiabank downgraded América Móvil from an outperform rating to a sector perform rating in a report on Wednesday, July 12th. The Goldman Sachs Group raised their price objective on América Móvil from $24.00 to $25.00 and gave the company a neutral rating in a research report on Thursday, July 20th.

articles.title: GATES ANNOUNCES SECONDARY OFFERING OF 15,000,000 ORDINARY SHARES
articles.author: PRNewswire
articles.excerpt: DENVER, Aug. 8, 2023 /PRNewswire/ -- Gates Industrial Corporation plc (NYSE: GTES, "Gates" or the "Company") announced today that certain selling stockholders affiliated with Blackstone Inc. (the…
articles.summary:
DENVER
, 
Aug. 8, 2023
 /PRNewswire/ -- Gates Industrial Corporation plc (NYSE: GTES, "Gates" or the "Company") announced today that certain selling stockholders affiliated with Blackstone Inc. (the "Selling Stockholders") have commenced a secondary offering of 15,000,000 of Gates' ordinary shares (the "Offering"). In connection with the Offering, the Selling Stockholders intend to grant to the underwriters a 30-day option to purchase up to 2,250,000 additional ordinary shares.
Gates Industrial Corporation
(PRNewswire)
Gates is not offering any ordinary shares in the Offering and will not receive any proceeds from the sale of ordinary shares in the Offering.

articles.title: Moody's cuts credit ratings of ten US banks and warns six more could face a similar fate – but firm insists ‘US banking system is NOT broken'
articles.excerpt: Visit the post for more.
articles.summary:
Wall Street's main stock indexes dropped Tuesday after Moody's slashed the credit ratings of several regional US banks and warned it may also downgrade some of the nation's biggest lenders.The move came months after a banking crisis sent shockwaves through the financial sector this spring, when the nation witnessed the three biggest US lender failures since the 2008 financial crisis.
 
The banking sector has since appeared to stabilize, but Moody's new ratings moves rattled investors and sent shares of the ‘Big Four' US banks – JPMorgan, Bank of America, Citigroup and Wells Fargo – down between 0.

articles.title: Wall Street WhatsApp, texting fines exceed $2.5 billion
articles.author: Austin Weinstein
articles.excerpt: Wells Fargo & Co. and BNP Paribas SA are among firms that will pay hundreds of millions of dollars in penalties for employees using unofficial communications like WhatsApp, personal texts or e
articles.summary:
SEC officials said they were well aware of other companies that weren't complying. 'So here are three takeaways for those firms who haven't yet done so: self-report, cooperate and remediate,' said Gurbir Grewal, the SEC's head of enforcement. 'If you adopt that playbook, you'll have a better outcome than if you wait for us to come calling.'


Tuesday's slate of penalties is nowhere near the end of regulators' efforts to crack down on Wall Street's use of unmonitored messaging apps. A wide swath of firms have disclosed that regulators are looking at their messaging practices, including banks Fifth Third Bancorp and Truist Financial Corp.
